title: britains loneliest lion could moved
story: Britains loneliest lion could be moved from his home after second playmate diesBailey has been left all alone after his -year-old cousin Naja was put down last week following a rapid deterioration in her healthBailey is alone now after his cousins died Image: Shanice Moore   SWNS.COMByKelly-Ann MillsNews Reporter:,  Mar |comments A lion thought to be Britainaposs loneliest could be relocated from his home of  years to be with lionesses, after losing his second female companion in just two years.Bailey the lion has been king of the pride at Colchester Zoo in Essex since  when he arrived with his cousins Naja and Malika. But Bailey has been left all alone, after -year-old Naja was put down last week following a rapid deterioration in her health. It comes less than  months after the pair lost Malika in October , at the age of . Now, staff at Colchester Zoo are keeping a close eye on lonely Bailey and are even considering relocating him to another zoo with a pride of lionesses.  In a statement issued on their website earlier this week, zoo staff wrote: We would like to thank all our visitors for the overwhelming support that we have received following the devastating news of the passing of our female lioness, Naja, on Friday, March . We have received many kind messages towards our staff, as well as concerns about our male lion, Bailey. Bailey’s health and welfare is our top priority and, whilst our Animal Care Team continues to monitor him daily, discussions have been put in place by the Animal Care Management Team regarding Bailey’s future at Colchester Zoo. The team are currently exploring bringing in a female lioness for Bailey, but this option is reliant on a lioness being available at one of our neighbouring zoos. However, given Bailey’s age, introducing a female at this stage in his le could prove too stressful. The team are also exploring relocating Bailey to another zoo with a pride of lionesses. This would be dependent on another organisation having the space to house Bailey and the move alone could prove too much. Bailey has become a big part of the Colchester Zoo family and parting with him feels almost impossible and irresponsible. Read more Our Animal Care Team will continue to monitor Bailey’s mental and physical welfare over the next few weeks. It’s our responsibility to ensure that Bailey’s welfare is at the forefront of any decision made, which may include letting him live out the rest of his le here at the zoo by himself. A previous statement last week paid tribute to Naja, writing: Naja was truly one of a kind. Her personality and character set her aside from any other animal we’ve had the pleasure to work with. Naja had a gentle side where she would interact with her keepers, but very quickly changed when food was available! Not only will all the staff at Colchester Zoo miss Naja, but she also leaves behind our male lion, Bailey. Bailey and Naja were cousins along with Naja’s sister, Malika, who passed away back in . All three lions had a strong bond, with the bond between Bailey and Naja made even stronger with the loss of Malika. title: couple 31 dogs left devastated
story: Couple with  dogs left devastated after being forced out their homeSue Bell and Dave Haywood run the UKs only dalmatian sanctuary and have issued an urgent plea for help to find a new home near Lancashire big enough to house their  dogsDave Haywood with some of his dalmatians Image: SWNSByLauren BeavisLottie GibbonsPaige Freshwater:,  Mar |commentsA couple with  dogs have issued a desperate plea for help after being forced out their home.Sue Bell, , and Dave Haywood, , run the UKaposs only dalmatian sanctuary.They treat the rehomed dogs like kids - letting them live inside their converted stable and allowing them on sofas and beds. But they have put out an urgent plea for help to find a new home, close to Lancashire, for their family - as their isolated location has become uninhabitable. DAS Dalmatians is currently based just outside Newton Abbott, Devon - or the middle of nowhere, as they describe it.to our TeamDogs newsletter for your weekly dose of dog news, pictures and stories.The property gets flooded every time it rains, and the roads are so bad that emergency services cannot reach it, reports the LiverpoolEcho.Sue said: We live in a stable that is down a bridleway. No one will deliver anything.aposaposA few weeks ago we had an electrical fire, and we were very lucky that Dave and I were awake otherwise who knows what could have happened.aposaposThe couple were forced to stop taking in new dogs last month due to the state of their premises. But they want to keep to continue on their mission to help dalmatians, so they are now appealing for dog-friendly potential landlords to get in touch. The couple currently live in a triple stable, with a kitchen, two bedrooms, a bathroom and a lounge - which is usually filled with dalmatians. And le with a pack of dogs is tough - as it means getting up before sunrise to let the dogs out into their field. Sue said: Biscuit likes to sing to us at .am every morning until one of us gets up and lets him onto our bed. Thankfully heaposs the only one that does that. The dogs donapost live in kennels or cages - instead lounging about on the beds and sofas around their converted stable home.  Dinnertime consists of shovelling out kg of dog biscuits every day, with Sue on hand to make sure every dog gets enough. Sue, a full-time dog mum, said: Le with these dogs is madness - but I wouldnapost have it any other way. You have to be dotty to have so many spotties. Iaposve always loved dogs but I love dalmatians because they are dferent. The first dog the couple helped was a six-month-old puppy who was being sold as part of a drug deal. Sue said: The poor little mite was very skinny, dirty and stunk of smoke. We have been asked to help more and more dogs over the years and have never wanted to stop. The couple rehome the dalmatians that are able to live a normal le after being assessed and rehabilitated but take in the kids that cannot be rehomed. She said: These pups stay with us forever being loved and having the best we can give them. We also help dogs that other rescues say no to. If a dog needs our help, I will do whatever I can do to helpwe have room but sadly at the moment, we can not help dogs that are threatened to be euthanised as we do not have room to keep them separated while being assessed.  The eldest of their dogs are Zakky and Zena, aged  who has been with Sue for two years. The pair are brother and sister whose owner died and left them on their own. Sue said: Zakky has a long bite history and bit Dave on meeting him - which can happen quite often with new problem kids. Zakky took a while to realise he didn’t have to bite anymore and now is one of the family and very loving. Zena now has dementia but still knows how to con her Dad into sharing his food with her. We stopped them from being separated - another rescue was going to split them up but they were  years old, it would have been awful for them to do that so they came here. They need to find a new home soon so they can take more dogs - and ideally, one that is in a more suitable location, more easily accessible for food deliveries and vet visits. Sue said: There are no kennels and as the dogs are free-range, they are very happy and don’t bark. Keeping them in a home environment is much better for their well-being. We live in a stable that is down a bridleway. No one will deliver anything. We are on the side of a valley, so every time it rains it floods us. The roof has holes in it so we are exposed to the elements. In summer it is so dusty - I get such bad chest infections. The road is so narrow and bumpy that emergency services are also unable to reach us. aposaposOn Sunday we had an electrical fire, and we were very lucky that Dave and I were awake otherwise who knows what could have happened.aposapos Sue continued: People donapost realise that the dogs are so quiet because they donapost live in kennels - they donapost make a noise. We have so many wonderful dogs that need our care, a huge mixture of ages - and we donapost want them to live in mud anymore.aposapos Sue and Dave, who run the sanctuary full-time, are ideally after a long term let, within a few hours drive of Morecambe Bay in a rural setting with at least an acre of land and a yard.You can donate to the sanctuary here. Do you have a dog story to sell  Email paige.freshwater@reachplc. news uk-news delta-omicron-covid-hybrid-detected-"Stealth Omicron: What is the BA. iant BySam Elliott-GibbsReporter:,  Mar |comments A Delta-Omicron coronavirus hybrid has been detected in the UK as experts warn the government it shouldnapost be ignored. Dubbed ‘Deltacron’, the new French-based strain combines both lineages. However, its severity is not yet known.But there is a warning that immunity is waning in the elderly as one scientist added that it is aposthe real thingapos. The World Health Organisation said it is apostracking and discussingapos the iant following research into the strain. There is no clear data yet to show whether Deltacron is more infectious than its predecessors. Health chiefs told The Sun a very small number of cases have been detected in Britain, but more details are to be reported in a briefing on Friday.Aris Katzourakis, professor of evolution and genomics at the University of Oxford, said: “It is one to keep an eye on. This one is legit. Dr Stephen Grfin, a virologist at the University of Leeds, said: “Whilst it doesn’t seem to have taken off as a dominant strain yet, this could be due to a very slow start based upon seeding density - the number of initial cases, he said.“There are multiple scenarios that can play out here in terms of what this means for people that become infected as this combination of viral proteins may behave dferently to either parent. “The French cluster appears to be a validated occurrence where a recombination event has given rise to a virus fit enough to circulate.Last month, the UK Health Security Agency announced it was investigating a iant named “Delta x Omicron Recombinant ”.However, it is not knownthis is linked to the French-based Deltacron.  Hospitalisation in the UK have shown an aposuptickapos in the past fortnight, data shows. The ZOE Covid Symptom Study estimates around , people are catching Covid each day - a  per cent hike in one week. Study co-founder Professor Tim Spector said: “The ‘official’ UK dashboard rate that continues to provide a misleading picture of the pandemic in the UK and should be scrapped. “The major increase in new cases across the country and in the elderly is a worry, especially as we now see an uptick in hospitalisations for the first time. “This increase was predicted when all restrictions were lted. “We are likely to continue to see high infection and prevalence rates of  in  people for the foreseeable future.” Dr Jenny Harries, head of the UKHSA, said: “The increasing presence of the BA. sub-lineage of Omicron and the recent slight increase in infections in those over  show that the pandemic is not over and that we can expect to see Covid circulating at high levels.” Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON University of OxfordCoronavirus" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get our daily coronavirus briefing with all the news you need to know direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: i didnt save crazy crufts
story: I didnt save crazy Crufts hero Kratu - he saved me from addiction and abuseTess Swan, , whose book, Incredible Kratu, was published this week, credits her dog with helping her recover after she fell into a spiral of addiction and abuseTess Swan with Kratu Image: Fiona Bond PhotographyByMatt RoperFeatures writer:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |comments When Kratu the Romanian rescue dog went rogue during an agility trial at Crufts in  he ended up the star of the show, delighting everyone who watched with his hilarious performance. Chased by owner Tess Swan, Kratu bounded gleefully around the course, missing jumps, ignoring obstacles and even running over to say hello to a group of volunteers mid-way through.Then he ran into a plastic tunnel and failed to come out the other side, finally emerging from the end he had gone in. Commentator Peter Purvis declared: “I love it. That’s the real trick, to turn around in there. How did he do that ” The joyful display won Kratu, a fluffy Carpathian-Mioritic mix, fans around the world and invites back to Crufts for the next two years.  His  agility performance, his last before retiring, was just as show-stopping, the mischievous Kratu even making off with a pole from one of the hurdles. But while Kratu and Tess’s Crufts appearances never fail to amuse, the story of how they found each other – and rescued each other – is truly heartwarming. Tess, , whose book, Incredible Kratu, was published this week, credits him with helping her recover after she fell into a spiral of addiction and abuse. She says: “He saved my le. I was very tired of le. Some of my memories are horric. I saved Kratu’s le, and he’s saved mine many times. “He’s the reason I get up every morning.”Undiagnosed autistic Tess’s le began to fall apart at the age of  after her father died and she found herself living in a filthy squat in a block of flats in Lambeth, south London. After her boyfriend died of a drugs overdose, Tess turned to heroin as “a respite from the pain”. She says: “I’d tried to take my own le a couple of times. Living was so painful. I was lost in a world I could not understand or navigate. I encountered much abuse and violence, I learnt to survive.” Tess, who had a daughter in this time, got deeply involved in London’s criminal world. But contracting hepatitis C was a “wake-up call” and she moved to Cambridgeshire, where she got clean, but still struggled with PTSD. Then a dog rescuer friend, Celia, found a “frightened pup” in a Roma camp in Romania. Tess says: “She told me she knew he was the one for me. I soon fell in love with him, I knew he was going to be my best friend.” But he was a handful – “like having the Honey Monster on a lead” – so she got help from dog trainer Wendy Kruger at Wood Green Animal Shelter in Godmanchester, Cambs. Kratu came on so well she entered him into some agility courses at dog shows. Tess recalls his first, saying: “We were just coming up to the last jump and he turned around and did the entire course backwards, with me chasing him in astonishment. “It was hilarious.”  Tess and Kratu entered Crufts in , when he completed the course without many mishaps. It was on theirthe next year that he stole the show. Tess says: “When he went into that tunnel and didn’t come out the other end, I was like a rabbit in the headlights. It was like, ‘Where the b****y hell has my dog gone ’ “Afterwards I gave him a big hug. I realised what he did was far better, he was a free spirit. That ticked all my boxes. I just embraced him for the rebel and the rascal that he is.  “He makes me laugh so much and that’s one of the biggest gts for me, to laugh, after a letime of crying and pain and sadness and despair. “We look at each other, I laugh and he woofs. We have the deepest animal human bond.” Incredible Kratu by Tess Eagle Swan and Lynne Barrett-Lee is available now . news uk-news kate-middleton-shed-tear-wedding-"Kate Middletons wedding dress revisitedByJenner NewtonRoyal Features Writer:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |comments It may have been a grand wedding with almost , guests packed into Westminster Abbey for the service, but the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge managed to make the historical day a very personal one. Kate had her sister Pippa as her maid of honour while Prince William chose his younger brother Prince Harry as his best man.Harry kept up best man tradition by giving a speech at the wedding reception - and according to many of the guests it was the highlight of the big day, evenhe did make Kate cry. Royal author Katie Nicholl gave an insight into the tear-jerking speech in her biography Harry: Le, Loss, and Love.  She said: It was affectionate, warm and funny and touched William deeply. The speech was peppered with Harryaposs classic sense of humour, and he ribbed his brother: aposWilliam didnapost have a romantic bone in his body before he met Kate, so I knew it was serious when William suddenly started cooing down the phone at Kateapos. Famous for his mimicry, Harry then impersonated his brother calling Kate aposBabykinsapos, to much laughter from the guests. Love the royals for the Mirroraposs daily newsletter to get all the latest news on the Queen, Charles, Kate, Wills, Meghan, Harry and the rest of The Firm. Click here to sign up. When he said the couple’s decade-long romance was his inspiration, there was a shy smile from Chelsy, while Kate shed a tear. Kate and brother-in-law Harry previously had a jovial relationship - he even famously described Kate as the sister he never had and the pair were often seen giggling or sharing a joke at royal events.But according to royal expert Duncan Larcombe, Harry and Kateaposs sibling-like relationship is now long in the past.  It comes amid a growing feud between William and Harry and the fact that Harry and we Meghan Markle decided to quit as royals and leave the UK for Calornia. And speaking earlier this year as Kate approached her th birthday, Duncan told OK! : Kate was, as Harry said, the sister he never had and clearly that is not the case anymore.There was a time when Harry would have been instrumental in any celebrations or any fun that the couple were having, but those days are long in the past. title: miracle baby born 23 weeks
story: Miracle baby born at  weeks with % chance of survival finally goes homeLucas Chialton-Helliar was the size of a "biro pen" when he was delivered at just  weeks at LiverpoolWomens Hospital, with doctors warning the tot had a % chance of survivalSarah Chialton said Lucas is doing really well after being discharged from hospitalByOlivia WilliamsMatthew DreschNews Reporter:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |comments A miracle baby who was born at just  weeks and had a % chance of survival has finally made it home. Lucas Chialton-Helliar was the size of a biro pen when he was delivered at Liverpool Womenaposs Hospital in October last year.Mum Sarah Chialton found out she was going into early labour after telling doctors about a small amount of aposunusual dischargeapos she had noticed.Sarah, from Litherland, Merseyside, went into hospital to get examined and was told she was already dilated, the Liverpool Echo reports.The -year-old said: I was  weeks pregnant and I was in work and I noticed - because I am a nurse myself - I noticed a little bit of unusual discharge. So I rang the Liverpool Womenaposs Hospital up and they told me to come in to get examined.They thought it was down to a water infection at the time. So I went into the Womenaposs, got examined and they said I was cm dilated. Sarah was going into early labour and doctors told her thather baby was to survive delivery, there was only a % survival rate in the first few weeks of his le. The mum added: That was at  weeks and one day, so they were going through scenarios with me. They said a  week baby doesnapost have a good outcome basically.  Doctors were saying it was a % chance of survival in the first couple of weeksthe baby was to survive delivery. Lucas came into the world weighing lb oz at  weeks and four days and Sarah said he was the size of a biro pen.The baby boy went through a lot during his  day stay in hospital, including six dferent infections, sepsis, two collapsed lungs and several blood transfusions.Lucas was discharged from Liverpool Womenaposs Hospital on Sunday, March , when he was four months old.  Get all the latest news sent to your inbox.for the free Mirror newsletter Sarah and her family described Lucas as a miracle and the -year-old wanted to thank staff at the neonatal unit at Liverpool Womenaposs Hospital. She said: I want to praise the neonatal unit at the Womenaposs because they have just been amazing through this. The nurses, the doctors have all been amazing. Sarah said her placenta was sent off for tests to look into why she went into early labour but the results left doctors unsure as to why she did. The -year-old said Lucas is now doing really well since being discharged from hospital at the weekend and is currently on home oxygen. He now weighs lbs. She said: Lucas is doing well, really well. Heaposs taking feeds and bottles as well. Heaposs brilliant, heaposs doing really well. Sarah said she wanted to share her story to thank staff at Liverpool Womenaposs Hospital and to help other mums who might be going through something similar. The nurse said she wanted mums going through the same thing to know there is aposlight at the end of it. title: mum gives birth three babies
story: Mum gives birth to three babies in just  months - and theyre not tripletsStephanie Hanson has spoken on TIkTok how discovered she was pregnant with twins, just three months after giving birth to her first-born child DaphneStephanie Hanson gave birth to Rubie and Penelope some  months after welcoming Daphne into the world Image: TikTok stphmchhansByMirror:,  Mar A woman has given birth to three babies within the space of just twelve months, after falling pregnant with twins soon after having her first baby. Stephanie Hanson welcomed her first daughter, Daphne, into the world on January , . It was just three months later that she discovered she was pregnant again, and was shockingly already three weeks along.Ten months after Daphne’s birthday, she gave birth to twin daughters Rubie and Penelope - on December  of the same year, reports.Women typically only begin ovulating again around  days, or six weeks, after giving birth.So Stephanie was in total disbelief upon discovering the pregnancy test she took around this time was positive, and she was already three weeks along. “I was in a newborn fog, and [then] there was the excitement of this new relationship,” she said. “I was just adjusting to everything. She said her first thought was for little Daphne she was concerned that her first-born wouldn’t have one-on-one time with her anymore. However, Stephanie said Daphne was “delighted” upon meeting her newborn twin sisters, and wanted to give them hugs right away. The sisters are now very close, Stephanie said, sharing a room and doing everything together.  Stephanie, who is no longer with the twins’ father, shares her parenting journey on TikTok, where she shares with followers how she manages co-parenting and having three young children all very close in age. She said it’s “not always easy”, but claimed she was “the happiest [she’d] ever been in her entire le”. “These kids are the best thing that’s ever happened to me,” she said. Another video she shared on the  went over how she and her “baby daddy” were dedicated to raising happy children. While they lived in dferent homes, they were on the same team, she said. title: mum who delivered parcels extra
story: Mum who delivered parcels for extra cash quits day job now earning £, a weekAtlanta Martin, , quickly settled into her side-hustle as a delivery driver which she fit around her day job at Gatwick Airport and now earns £, a weekAtlanta Martin, , has turned her side-hustle into a flexible and lucrative careerByCharlotte Penketh-KingLaura SharmanNews Reporter:,  Mar |commentsA hardworking mum who started delivering packages to make a bit of extra cash has been able to quit her day job after discovering she can earn a whopping £, a week.Atlanta Martin, , was working as a flight dispatcher at Gatwick Airport when she decided to take on another role three years ago. She quickly settled on being a delivery driver, which she could fit around her current hours at the airport and soon realised how lucrative her second job could be.The mum-of-one, from Worthing, West Sussex, did so well that she eventually decided to quit her day job after two years. She can now rake in up to a grand a week by putting in -hour days and is able to plan her schedule around her two-year-old daughter.  And the profit she has made from the delivery job is enough to fund a nice lestyle, including a recent trip to Disney World in Florida. Atlanta said: Iaposm really happy I made the decision to do this job full time. With delivering, I can choose my own hours, work as much as I wish too and earn the same money or more. It was a risk as delivering is self employed and the money is not guaranteed, but I have no regrets and it is working really well.  Atlanta worked at Gatwick prior to giving birth and realised that she could make extra money by delivering while on maternity leave. She said: I worked there for three and a half years but I have a daughter who is coming up to three years old. The hours I had to work and the sht pattern was not flexible enough at the airport. I started delivering whilst on my maternity leave as an extra form of income. Thanks to the flexibility of delivering, I found I could work the hours I wanted to around my daughter. I started posting videos of me delivering on my social media which did really well so I decided to leave my full time job so I could pursue delivering and growing my social media channels.  Since ditching the airport job, Atlanta has been putting in the hours working on her own time delivering in the car for Just Eat, Uber Eats, Deliveroo and Beelivery. She starts as early as am and works until as late as :pm - racking up around  deliveries on a busy day. Her hard work has been worth it as sheaposs been raking in the cash, making up to £, a week through delivering across the south east of England. Between February  and February  alone, she earned £. from Just Eat, £. from UberEats, £. from Deliveroo and £. from Beelivery, as well as £ in cash tips - totalling at an impressive £. in just one week.  Atlanta was amazed by the amount of money sheaposs been making alongside her boyfriend, Benjamin Hasker, , who also works as a delivery driver as well as a magician and doing Punch and Judy shows. The mum has no plans toto the airline industry and is thrilled with her new career. She said: Itaposs not guaranteed to be £, every week - the more hours you put in, the more you earn. Thanks to my hard work earning this amount of money, myself, my daughter and my partner all went to Disney World, Florida, for two weeks in December  . This was my daughteraposs first ever holiday. I have already bought two cars outright in the time that I have been delivering for work. I havenapost bought anything for my daughteraposs third birthday yet as it is in June, but we are planning to go to London for the weekend for a trip to London Zoo. Iaposm really happy I chose to pursue this as a full time career. It was a risk but I have no regrets. news uk-news prince-charles-plans-slim-down-"Prince Charles and Camilla show their support for UkraineBySam Elliott-GibbsReporter:,  Mar |commentsPrince Charles has had a long-term plan to trim down the monarchy once he takes to the throne and it could serve as a warning after recent high profile problems, a royal expert says.The Firm has, of course, already undergone some major structural changes in the past few years. The Duke and Duchess of Sussex have decided their future is not in the UK, while Prince Andrew is not expected to everto public le.But the enforced alterations donapost begin to scratch the surface of whataposs ahead, some believe.Do you enjoy reading about the royal family for all the best royal news from the Mirror here  Charles has long been prepping for the new era and he has Palace hangers-on firmly in his eye-line. It has long been said that the -year-old plans a major shake-up of the when he becomes head of state - and it could also affect royal residences. It remains to be seen which members of the family will be trimmed but analyst Jonathan Sacerdoti told the Mirrror things are about to become very modern.He said: I think when Charles takes to the throne we will see the emphasis put on those who command absolute respect.  The demands of responsibility and certain behaviours that are needed will be at the forefront - simply, you must be totally reliable. It is well known that Charles wants to stamp his mark and in modern times, donapost be surprised to see changes made. It will be a very handy way to respond to the recent controversies, such as Prince Andrew, as well as Prince Harryaposs attacks on the family. The core will be there, and Prince George will join in time - I think that is clear.  But it’s always been speculated that Charles, when he eventually takes over, will want to slim down the working royals at the heart of the family. It will be about commanding respect. I think he is looking forward to being King. It is not simply a change of personnel thataposs ahead of us. Senior royals are acutely aware of the requirement to prove they are value for money and the weight of this responsibility has weighed heavily on the Prince of Wales.  Opening of Buckingham Palace to the public is one idea that the future king is said to be keen to explore. Thereaposs a sense that he wants a slimmed down monarchy to make sure that everybody is doing their bit and [there are] no so-called hangers-on, royal expert Camilla Tominey said. “It does make the future of the monarchy kind of uncertain. “We’ve had this model that the Queen has been at the head of for all of this time, because she’s obviously been on the throne for nearly seven decades.”“That means by association that you’re going to have fewer royals taking on fewer patronages, and then what does that mean for the charities ” she told The ’s Royal Insight podcast.Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Buckingham PalacePrince Charles, Prince of WalesRoyal Family" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get our daily royal round-up direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: prince harry not negative queen
story: Prince Harry will not be negative about the Queen in memoir, claims biographerThe book will not be "warts and all" publication and Finding Freedom author Omid Scobie claims Harry is going "out of his way" to avoid damaging his grandmother the Queen.Prince Harry and The Queen Image: Getty ImagesByGraeme Murray:,  Mar Prince Harry has reportedly avoided being negative about the Queen in his new memoir. He is poised to publish a tell-all publication which promises to be his and Meghan Markleaposs finale moment claims their friend and unofficial biographer Omid Scobie.The book, however, will not be warts and all and the Finding Freedom author claims Harry is going out of his way to avoid damaging his grandmother the Queen, reports OK! magazine. Scobie told an episode of the Royally Obsessed podcast: Iaposve been told by sources that Harry is going out of his way to make sure there is nothing in there that could be construed as being negative towards the Queen or her reign in any way.  He added: I donapostapos think that aposwarts and allapos moment is going to happen. The book is tipped to to go on sale later this year and may royal watchers were concerned about what its contents. It was first suggested it could reveal the Princeaposs true feelings towards his step-mother Camilla while others suggested it would aposshake the monarchy to its core.  A £ million memoir deal was signed by Harry with J R Moehringer which his publishers have described as the definitive account of the experience, adventures, losses, and le lessons that have helped shape him. Harry did not warn the Royal Yamily of his decision to write a book, it has believed, which reportedly left many in the Firm aposblindsidedapos by the announcement. Prince Harry and his grandmother have always shared a particularly close bond and royals aficionados believe any revelations he does make will not include her. During Harry and Meghanaposs controversial Oprah interview he spoke of his respect for his grandmother and said that he had spoken to her a great deal recently. His we, meanwhile, spoke about how she loved being in the Monarchaposs company. She added. The Queen has always been wonderful to me, she added. title: princess diana burst laughter prince
story: Princess Diana burst into laughter at Prince Charles unromantic proposalA royal expert shared details of Prince Charles proposal to Princess Diana in the Channel  documentary Charles and Di: The Truth Behind Their Wedding, where she revealed it wasnt very romanticDiana got engaged to Prince Charles in , and the pair wed six months later Image: Tim Graham Photo Library via Getty ImagesByPaige HollandShowbiz Audience Writer:,  Mar |commentsPrincess Diana and Prince Charles apos wedding was something out of a fairytale - but the proposal was anything but romantic.Diana was just  years old - more than a decade younger than her future husband - when she was invited to Windsor Castle for a visit that would change her le forever. As she arrived at the historical royal home, Charles told her he had missed her so much, before he led her to the nursery, unknowingly to her, to pop the question. Charles had only met Diana  times, but by the time she left the castle, she was engaged to the future king. Appearing on the Channel  documentary Charles and Di: The Truth Behind Their Wedding, Majesty magazine editor Ingrid Seward shared details on the not-so-romantic proposal. Love the royals for the Mirroraposs daily newsletter to get all the latest news on the Queen, Charles, Kate, Wills, Meghan, Harry and the rest of The Firm. Click here to sign up. She claims the heir to the throne proposed in the nursery at Windsor Castle because the nursery is like a home. And in response Diana burst out laughing, she claims. I think that was probably just her nerves. She didnapost think it was the most romantic of proposals but she had the proposal. Royal biographer Christopher Wilson added: She was completely bowled over by this, didnapost see it coming.  He said: Prince Charles didnapost pick her up in his arms and embrace or do any of the things we might do when we propose marriage to the one that we love. He rang his mum, simply to say aposthere, Iaposve done it now. Youaposve asked me to get married to somebody and Iaposve fixed it.apos What heaposd done was heaposd finally found a we.In a later interview, Diana revealed further details about the proposal. She said: He said do you realise that one day youaposll be Queen. And I said aposI love you so much, I love you so muchapos. He said aposwhatever loves meansapos. He said it then. So I thought, that was great. I thought he meant it. And in the biography, Diana: Her True Story, the Princess reflected: A voice said to me inside, aposYou wonapost be queen but you will have a tough role... aposYes,apos I said. aposI love you so much, I love you so much.apos He said, aposWhatever love meansapos and so he ran upstairs and rang his mother.Have you got a story to share We want to hear all about it. news uk-news queen-just--minutes-notice-"Prince Philip and The Queen were adorable says Prince HarryByKieren WilliamsNews Reporter:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |commentsThe Queen was reportedly given just  minutesapos notice of Prince Harry’s announcement that he was not attending his grandfather’s memorial service.Harry released a statement about Prince Phillip’s service, saying he will not be ing to the UK and claimed he would feel unsafe after he lost his personal security following his move to the US with we, Meghan Markle.And senior aides have reportedly revealed Harry did not give the Queen much notice of his decision.They told the Sun Her Majesty was informed of his decision to snub the event a quarter of an hour before his statement came out.Harry’s statement read: “The Duke will not be ing to the UK in late March, but hopes to visit his grandmother as soon as possible.”This came amid a High Court row Prince Harry is waging with with the Home Office after his armed bodyguards were removed. Will you be sad to see Harry miss the memorial  Have your say in the comment section He said he would feel unsafe bringing his two children Archie, two, and Lilibet, nine months, over to the UK. Experts previously claimed Harry would have been given aposadequateapos protection for the March  event in Westminster Abbey, and during his stay in Windsor. Harry had said long ago he felt it was not safe to bring his we or children back to the country. Angela Levin, Harry’s biographer, told the Sun: “He has snubbed the Duke of Edinburgh but really he is snubbing the Queen.”  She said the Queen was still grieving the loss of Philip, her husband of  years, and suggested Harry may well use the same reasoning to avoid attending his grandmotheraposs Platinum Jubilee celebration as well. She went on: “He has got this all wrong. If he comes over for a royal event he gets police protection. What they won’t do is,he goes out with his friends he gets security.” Harry has been back to the UK only twice since leaving for the US in  with we Meghan. He ed for Philip’s funeral last April only days after he told Oprah Winfrey of racist comments made by royal family members about his children, without revealing who he was referring to. Two months later he attended an unveiling of a statue of his mother, Princess Diana, at Kensington Palace.This comes as Buckingham Palace revealed today that the Queen would not be attending the Commonwealth Service on Monday.Instead, Prince Charles will be attending in her place. In a statement the palace said: “The Queen has asked The Prince of Wales to represent Her Majesty at the Commonwealth Service at Westminster Abbey on Monday.” Love the royals for the Mirroraposs daily newsletter to get all the latest news on the Queen, Charles, Kate, Wills, Meghan, Harry and the rest of The Firm. Click here to sign up .Even though she is not attending, she is still due to carry on with other planned engagements for next week. This was due to be the -year-oldaposs first in-person public engagement since she was advised to rest by her doctors. Other royals including Camilla, Prince William and Kate Middleton, and Princess Alexandra will all still attend the annual service for the Commonwealth of  nations which the Queen heads.  In a full statement, Buckingham Palace said: After discussing the arrangements with the Royal Household, The Queen has asked The Prince of Wales to represent Her Majesty at the Commonwealth Service at Westminster Abbey on Monday. The Queen will continue with other planned engagements, including in person audiences, in the week ahead. The Queenaposs Commonwealth Day message will be distributed in the usual way. title: queen secret tunnel out windsor
story: Queen has secret tunnel out of Windsor Castle - and its hidden under the carpetThe Queens Windsor Castle home is -years-old, boasts , square feet of space, , rooms, and a very secret tunnel which she can useshe ever needs to leave without people knowingWindsor Castle Image: PAByPaige HollandShowbiz Audience Writer:,  Mar |commentsThe Queen has a secret escape tunnel at Windsor Castle thataposs hidden by a trap door.The royal residence, which serves both as Her Majesty aposs working palace and private home, is packed full of history and secrets since it was built back in the th century.As well as being a lovely place for the royals to stay, it was also a fortress, which means there are lots of hidden passages and former defences. Concealed underneath a carpet in one of the homeaposs offices, youaposll find a trap door that opens out into a tunnel, which the Queen can useshe needs to make a quiet getaway.A first-ever broadcast look inside the hidden passageway was shared in a  BBC documentary, The Queenaposs Palaces, where presenter Fiona Bruce said you can still find evidence of the castle’s war-like origins”“you know where to look.Love the royals for the Mirroraposs daily newsletter to get all the latest news on the Queen, Charles, Kate, Wills, Meghan, Harry and the rest of The Firm. Click here to sign up. She said: “This is an office just tucked away in a corner of Windsor Castle. But look under here. Asby magic, just lt these and the medieval castle emerges. She walks down the stone steps and gives a glimpse inside the tunnel itself. She says: If you’re a soldier in Windsor Castle under siege you need a way to get out. “And this is the secret passage. This is exactly what it looked like in the s. “It’s wide enough to accommodate a whole army of men. “You can just imagine them rushing down the stairs, and it leads out onto the street. “This is the clever bit - they’d then be able to sneak up on the enemy and attack them from behind.” The Queen isnapost the only member of the royal family whose residence has a secret tunnel. The Duke and Duchess of Cambridge live at apartment A inside Kensington Palace with their three children, Prince George, Princess Charlotte and Prince Louis. The Queen gave William and Kate the keys to the residence, which they also share with the Duke and Duchess of Kent, following their royal wedding in . The apartment features five reception rooms, three main bedrooms, dressing rooms, a night and day nursery, and staff quarters.But thataposs not all. It is also reported to have a panic room and secret tunnel that Prince William and Prince Harry are said to have used to sneak out to McDonaldaposs with their mum Princess Diana. Have you got a story to share We want to hear all about it. title: teacher accused dragging terrified special
story: Teacher accused of dragging terried special needs pupil across classroom by her legRachel Wadsworth, who teachers at Carstairs Junction Primary, faces being struck off after issues in her class of four and five year oldsRachel Wadsworth faces being struck off Image: Google MapsByKelly-Ann MillsNews ReporterRuaraidh Gilmour:,  Mar  A teacher has been accused of dragging a special needs pupil with special needs across a classroom floor by her leg, leaving a fellow staff member in tears.Rachel Wadsworth faces being struck off amid claims she pulled a four or five-year-old girl with a mental age of a toddler by the wrist at Carstairs Junction Primary in Lanarkshire.It is further alleged she hauled the same non-verbal child by the leg back into her classroom on a separate occasion and made her sit on a seat where she had urinated. Miss Wadsworth appeared before the General Teaching Council for Scotlandyesterday to face the claims, Glasgow Live reports. Support teacher Pamela Dougall gave evidence to the , and said she was left in tears after witnessing on the incidents. She said: I witnessed Miss Wadsworth dragging Pupil A back along the floor back to the classroom. Her [Pupil A] tummy was on the floor, she looked terried. I put my hands on my head and said aposyou canapost do thatapos. I asked Pupil Ashe was alright, she put her thumbs up as she is a non-verbal child. Pupil A has a mental age of roughly  to  months. I was in a state of shock, every time I saw Pupil A that day I cried.  She said: The working relationship with Miss Wadsworth was dficult. I got the feeling that she did not want anyone in the class. When I was working with Miss Wadsworth I felt I couldnapost do my job properly as she didnapost trust me. Another support teacher, Jacqueline Steele who was working in a class nearby, told the hearing : I was sitting at a table helping kids finish their work they hadnapost finished and I was looking directly out of the classroom door. I saw Pupil A running past the door.Pupil A stopped at the double doors [ fire exit].Mrs Wadsworth ran up and grabbed Pupil Aaposs arm in quite a forceful manner. Her tugging knocked Pupil A off her balance and she was walking too fast for her to keep up. I put my hands on my head. It was the first time I saw her look frightened. [When Mrs Steele entered Pupil Aaposs classroom] Pupil A was on the floor at the door, it was quite manic and Miss Wadsworth did not have any control of the class. For me it was a child protection issue. That afternoon Pupil A was not herself and was not smiling. You could seeshe looked sad, I was able to tell when she wasnapost happy. Further allegations have been lodged against the teacher such as grabbing the same pupil by the arm and pushing her back onto a chair. Miss Wadsworth also faces allegations that she grabbed another pupil by the shoulders which caused them distress. She has also been accused of leaving the pupils in her additional support needs class unattended. The hearing continues.Follow MirrorFacebookTwitterMORE ON EducationSchoolsTeachers" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: uk weather forecast ferocious 70mph
story: UK weather forecast: Ferocious mph winds and rain to batter country this weekendThe Met Office has issued yellow warnings for wind this weekend with ferocious gusts and rain expected to batter the country before the sun arrives with C temperaturesPeople are being warned over strong winds this weekend Image: PA Archive PA ImagesByTim HanlonNews Reporter:,  Mar |commentsBrits are being warned of a blustery weekend with ferocious winds and rain driving into the South West and then spreading across the country on Sunday.The Met Office has issued yellow warnings for wind and rain on both Saturday and Sunday with an unsettled picture ahead before a much improved outlook for next week with sun and temperatures rising as high as C.But for the weekend there is likely to be a battering from the strong winds and plenty of rain.The Met Office weather warning covers the South West on Saturday and runs from pm until pm.It states: “A spell of windy and wet weather during Saturday afternoon may lead to some travel disruption.”  It says: “Some delays to road, rail, air and ferry transport are likely. Probably some bus and train services affected, with some journeys taking longer. “Delays for high-sided vehicles on exposed routes and bridges likely and damage to trees possible. Some short term loss of power and other services is possible. It’s likely that some coastal routes, sea fronts and coastal communities will be affected by spray and or large waves.” Then more widespread yellow warnings are also in place for Sunday with similar advice to expect travel disruption. BBC weather forecaster Tomasz Schafernaker warned people that as well as the strong wind people will need their umbrellas.“A lot of cloud and some rain across Scotland, parts of northern England, brighter across the rest of England and Wales, and in fact some decent sunny spells through the middle of the afternoon and I think the best of the weather will be the further east you go, he said, looking at Saturday.  But notice this curl of rain here, this is a low pressure that is swinging into the south west of the UK. Not only rain but some very strong winds, we are talking of gusts of mph, mph and maybe even mph so it is really going to be quite stormy around some of the coasts.” Mr Schafernaker said it is not widespread but advised people in the South West to take care. Then on Sunday the strong winds will cover the country with the weather impacted by a low pressure system by the west of Scotland. Very gusty winds right across the country, we are talking mph, mph or maybe mph around some exposed coasts … on Sunday it will be blustery right across the UK. Temperatures on Sunday typically between C and C so not as mild as it has been but mild enough, said Mr Schafernaker.  Looking ahead to next week and people can expect spring-like temperatures especially in the south. Monday a much better day, the winds will be lighter there will be some sunshine around, still some showers around northern parts of the country but in the south it really is an improving picture and that’s how it is going to be over the next few days into next week, said Mr Schafernaker. In fact in the south of the country temperatures could peak around C or C. So a mixed weekend but better the week ahead.” UK forecast for the next  days Turning wet and windy in the Southwest this afternoon. Today: Sunny spells and showers this morning, with parts of Scotland seeing some more persistent rain. Showers fading for many this afternoon when wet and windy weather with heavy rain coastal gales develops over southwest England and southwest Wales. Tonight: Early evening rain in the southwest moves slowly northeastwards to extend from western Scotland into northwest England, the Midlands and southern England by dawn. Windy, with gales in the west. Sunday: Early rain over parts of Scotland and England clears eastwards, clearing the far east late afternoon. Otherwise, sunny spells and showers. Windy with coastal gales in the north and west. Outlook for Monday to Wednesday: Occasionally unsettled across northern and western areas, with spells of rain and strong winds. Generally drier where, with some mist and fog overnight, before some rain develops Wednesday. news uk-news vladimir-putins-odd-way-asking-"Vladimir Putin and we Lyudmila on state visit in ByRosaleen FentonDeputy Features Editor:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar Vladimir Putin has launched a devastating attack on Ukraine, in a bid to overthrow its democratically elected government. The odd, reclusive President has an intense daily schedule - and tries to keep intrusions into his personal le strictly limited.Putin married Lyudmila Shkrebneva in  and the couple had two daughters, Mariya and Yekaterina. Although he is notoriously secretive about his personal le, the couple announced their separation in a staged television interview in June . The orce was later confirmed by Lyudmilaaposs name being removed from Putinaposs official biography on the Kremlin website, so his biography simply mentions their children instead. In his  biography aposFirst Personapos, which contains a series of interviews with the Russian president and figures close to him, Lyudmila shared details of their relationship. In a frank chat, she revealed that she didnapost think much of the poorly dressed man she met outside a theatre while on a double date.Follow all todayaposs latest updates on the conflict with our live blog But the pair continued to keep in touch after Putin gave her his phone number - a rare move for the privacy-obsessed KGB officer. After three-and-a-half years, Putin proposed, but his subdued manner left Lyudmila convinced he was actually trying to dump her. She took the interviewee: One night we were sitting this house and he said, You know what kind of person I am by now. In general, Iaposm not very easygoing. He was being self-critical. He explained that he was the silent type that he was rather abrupt in some things and he could even insult people, and so on. He was saying that he was a risky le partner. And he added: In three and a half years, you have probably made up your mind. It sounded to me like we were breaking up. aposYes, Iaposve made up my mind,apos I said. He let out a doubtful aposYes apos Then I was sure that that was it, we were breaking up. But then he said, aposWell thenthat is the way it is, I love you and propose we get married.apos So it all came as a complete surprise to me. title: woman 80 becomes uks longest
story: Woman, , becomes UKs longest-serving female blood donor after giving  pintsChristine Newnham, , has saved many lives and never missed an appointment with her blood bank. The retired nurse has donated three times a year since the age of Christine Newnham has given blood  times over  years Image: SWNSByChloe OConnorMartin BagotHealth and Science editor:,  Mar |comments A great-grandmother is thought to have become the UK’s longest-serving female blood donor after giving  pints over  years.Christine Newnham, , has saved many lives and never missed an appointment with her blood bank. The retired nurse has donated three times a year since the age of . She said: “I was a nurse so needles never bothered me. I was happy to give blood. It made me really happy as I want to save lives. “It’s very simple to do and it doesn’t take up much of your time. I’ve also met so many people at the donor centre, I have so many friends there now I can’t keep up.” The NHS is , blood donors short of what it needs to recover from Covid, having relied on its smallest pool of donors in the st century during the pandemic.We are calling on readers to become a Mirror Blood Hero and register to become a donor. Christine, of Sittingbourne, Kent has seen the benefits of giving blood after a handful of close family members fell ill. She said: “When my daughter-in-law’s dad became sick with a rare type of leukaemia, he needed lots of transfusions. “He was given more time with us all and it was all down to blood donations, it’s an amazing thing. “I had two women approach me in the blood bank who thanked me for saving their lives. “I tried to explain it could have been anyone’s blood, but they just kept thanking me. It makes me cry every time I think about it.” Register as a donor and play your part in the NHS recovery.Visit www.blood or call     to register.Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON NHSLeukaemiaDaily Mirror,callToAction:ltpgtGet weekly highlights from Mirror editor Alison Phillips direct to your emaillt pgt,buttonText:,contentId:,newsletterImage:https:i-prod.mirror article.ece ALTERNATES sd _AlisonHeaderFinal.png,endpointUrl:https:response.pure interface list.php,profile:Reach_Mirror,isPureNewsLetter:true,pureMailingListId:Mirror - Alisons Newsletter,isDoubleOptIn:,newsletterSiteName:Mirror" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get weekly highlights from Mirror editor Alison Phillips direct to your emailInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news us-news meghan-markle-prince-harry-slam-"Meghan Markle and Prince Harry speak at Global Citizen LiveByJenner NewtonRoyal Features Writer:,  Mar |commentsPrince Harry and Meghan Markle are among those who have slammed the UK and other countries for not lting intellectual property rules when it comes to the Covid- vaccine.The couple are among  signatories of an open letter that says self-defeating nationalism, pharmaceutical monopolies and inequality stand in our way of ending the pandemic. The letter, which was published today, says the pandemic is not over and that the approach to vaccine equity is immoral, entirely self-defeating and also an ethical, economic and epidemiological failure.It says: The European Union, the United Kingdom, and Switzerland continue to block the lting of intellectual property rules which would enable the redistribution and scale-up of Covid- vaccines, test and treatment manufacturing in the global south. The transfer of largely publicly funded vaccine technology and know-how from pharmaceutical corporations would fast track production to a matter of months. Yet still today, a handful of these corporations retain the power to dictate vaccine supply, distribution and price – and the power to decide who lives and who dies. World leaders, and particularly rich nations, have the responsibility to change this situation and ensure the publicly funded vaccine technology and know-how is available to the global south. The letter, which comes on the second anniversary of Covid- being declared a pandemic, is also signed by actress Charlize Theron, former UK Prime Minister Gordon Brown and former Secretary-General of the United Nations Ban Ki-moon.Love the royals for the Mirroraposs daily newsletter to get all the latest news on the Queen, Charles, Kate, Wills, Meghan, Harry and the rest of The Firm. Click here to sign up . Meanwhile, it was also revealed today that the coupleaposs Archewell Foundation has pledged its support to The Peopleaposs Vaccine Alliance - a non-profit organisation that wants everybody across the world to have access to Covid vaccine, tests and treatments. Itaposs unknown how much they have invested. Their investment in the campaign was announced today on The Peopleaposs Vaccine Alliance Twitter page, which said it was proud to welcome Meghan and Harryaposs support.The tweet said: We are proud to welcome Archewell Foundation to the Alliance and appreciate their support, alongside Prince Harry and Meghan, The Duke and Duchess of Sussex.We will work together to end vaccine inequity and ensure COVID- vaccines, treatments and tests are available to everyone.Both Harry and Meghan have spoken out about vaccine equity in the past and last May, Harry made an appearance at Vax Live - a concert in Calornia to promote the sharing of vaccines.The couple has also previously written an open letter to the chief executives of pharmaceutical companies like Pfizer, Moderna and AstraZeneca urging them to redouble their support for the UN-sponsored Covax vaccine equity programme.And last September, during a mini-tour in New York City, the couple appeared at the at Global Citizen Live event in Central Park. During the event, Meghan said: “Every single person on this planet has a fundamental right to get this vaccine but thataposs not happening. “It is wrong that so much of the vaccine supply has only gone to just ten wealthy nations and not everyone , itaposs just not OK.” Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Meghan MarklePrince HarryRoyal Family" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get our daily royal round-up direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: influencer debunks how perfect bikini
story: Influencer debunks how perfect bikini snaps are taken - and shares real bum insteadA body-positive Instagram star has been praised for her refreshing honesty, debunking how influencers taking the perfect bikini and highlighting how social media isnt always realityHayley has a very important message to share with followersByJulia BanimAudience WriterSamantha BartlettSenior Lestyle  Travel Reporter:,  Mar |comments As much as we might try and remind ourselves that social media isnapost reflective of reality, knowing full well that we shouldnapost beat ourselves up for falling short of aposperfectionapos, is easier said than done at times.So itaposs always good when a bonafide influencer comes forward to lt the curtain on what actually goes into getting those impossibly aposperfectapos shots, reminding you that what you see in the bathroom mirror is just as beautul.As previously reported by theDaily Star,personal trainer Hayley Madigan - who champions all things reality, health, body confidence and fitness - has now come forward to expose the truth on how certain influencers get their butt looking a certain way, using her own bottom as an example. Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here.Using side-by-side pics, Hayley - who goes by the username @ hayleymadiganfitness - showed the dference between an Insta Pool Pose Vs What I see in the bathroom mirror, showing a posed pic next to what her bum looks like in reality.In a powerful caption, Hayley explained: Dferent poses, dferent camera angles, dferent posture, dferent lighting can all make a huge dference to how a body is perceived and more specically how you see your own body! You will see your body in all types of angles and poses. You will see your body relaxed and unposed. You will see yourself in many ways so do not let your eyes deceive you by telling you to feel negative towards your own body.  She continued: You have the power to change your mindset, to look at your own body in a kinder manner. To be kinder to yourself and to your mental health. To be kinder to your body, because it is your home and you only have one so treat it with the best kindness you can offer! We often pick holes in our bodies continuously but when you realise that no one worth having in your le wouldn’t ever pick those same holes about you is an important thing to remember. The people that care and love you do not see you the same way, all they see is the happiness, the love, and the sparkle that you bring to them and the world. You’re not just a body, you are YOU, so be kinder to yourself. Many people have been greatly touched by Hayleyaposs wise words, which are so very important in an age where le filtered through a social media lens can seriously impact the way we view our bodies.One person thanked Hayley for bringing some honesty to Instagram, really admire you for this, while another described her honesty as inspiring.A third person remarked that they wished such pics were shown in high schools, adding: I speak for myself around that age, I only saw the ‘perfect’ Instagram bodies. It’s easy to lose track of what is picture-perfect and what is real. I’d rather see everyday-perfect than picture-perfect more. Because we are perfect in our own way: every. single. one. of. us.Do you have a body positivity story to share  We pay for stories. title: i tried sushi cereal wasnt
story: Exclusive: I tried sushi cereal - it wasnt awful, but I couldnt stomach it every morningA new limited-edition cereal range has been launched celebrating three of Britains best-loved takeaway dishes: Sushi Roll, Margarita Pizza, and Chicken Katsu CurryI tried Sushi Roll, Margarita Pizza, and Chicken Katsu Curry flavoured cereal Image: DeliverooByJulia BanimAudience Writer:,  Mar |commentsIf asked to describe the taste of cereal, you will most likely imagine subtle wheaty textures, with maybe a bit of dried fruit or chocolate mixed inyou fancy a treat. Itaposs doubtful that additions such as tuna, olives, or turmeric will so much as cross your mind, with many of us preferring milder tastes before weaposve finished that all-important first cup of coffee.However, Deliveroo has rolled out a limited-edition trio of inventively savoury breakfast cereals, each one celebrating a popular takeaway dish.While stocks last, customers in London, Bristol, and Manchester can order a £ box of ‘DeliverOO’s’, selecting from a choice of Sushi Roll, Margherita Pizza, and Chicken Katsu Curry. Weaposve given the bizarre range a go for ourselves - and this is what we thought. Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here. Margherita Pizza CerealI for one have had many a cold leftover pizza slice for breakfast in my time, so didn’t think this one would present too much of a challenge. However, I did hesitate a bit before pouring the milk into the bowl of tiny puff buckwheat kernels.The tomatoey taste comes through quite strongly here - more so than the cheese - but certainly isn’t unpleasant, and thereaposs also a subtle suggestion of basil oil which gives it a surreal rustic Italian feel. Of course, itaposs quite weird to get the familiar taste of doughy, rippable pizza crust encased inside such light - and quickly quite mushy - grain, but this certainly makes for a fun novelty. Out of the three, this undoubtedly tasted the most like the takeaway it was meant to represent, but Iaposm not sure I could stomach it every day, and I didnapost end up finishing the bowl.  Chicken Katsu CurryCereal Katsu curry is one of my all-time favourite takeaway dishes and I was seriously worried that trying a twisted version of it might spoil it for me a bit. I needn’t have feared. I sampled a few of the crunchy maize flakes dry before tucking in properly, and can honestly say that Iaposd happily chow down this product like a bag of crisps. I enjoy anything spicy, and this has a little kick to it that - although not everyoneaposs cup of tea at  am - tickled my taste buds nicely. The curry powder comes through quite strongly here, but the milk pleasantly balances it out, bringing a nice cooling effect. This was my favourite out of the trio by quite a long way, and I found myself munching down spoonful after spoonful.  Sushi RollCereal Now, admittedly this is the one I feared the most. Don’t get me wrong, I love sushi, but the very thought of mixing fish and rice up in a bowl of milk first thing in the morning - even in cereal form - just didn’t sit right with me.I poured a few of the puffed brown rice kernels into the bowl and had a tentative nibble. The overall sushi flavouring came through much more vigorouslythan I thought it would, while a distinct note of wasabi took me by surprise.There was also a strong gingery aftertaste. The brown rice texture went well with this, but it wasn’t screaming cereal to me. After stalling for a minute, I poured a glug of milk into the bowl and held my breath. It was by no means awful, although perhaps not something I could regularly rush down before a morning commute. The milk didn’t compliment the cereal quite as well as it did with the Katsu onebut it was undoubtedly an interesting addition to my breakfast and I was left impressed by the realistically fresh flavour. Okay, so I donapost think Iaposll be switching from my Crunchy Nut Cornflakes anytime soon, but this trio of cereals certainly made for one of the most adventurous breakfasts Iaposve had in a while.A Deliveroo spokespersonsaid: When we heard it was World Cereal Day, we wanted to ‘bowl’ over cereal lovers with a breakfast dish to remember. We know our customers love to try weird and wonderful fusion dishes - which is why we’ve really milked it with this range of cereals.If you live in Manchester, Bristol or London, search ’DeliverOO’s’ in the app and for a bargain £ a pack, you can take a break from cereal monogamy and try something deliciously dferent for breakfast this week.If you fancy giving these unusual cereals a go, you can search ‘DeliverOO’s: Food Flavoured Cereal Shop’ on the Deliveroo app, or online to place an order. Subject to location and availability. title: schoolboy praised getting job can
story: Schoolboy praised for getting job so he can take crush out on McDonalds dateA -year-old schoolboy has been declared "an old-fashioned gent" after he earned enough money washing his uncles fleet of vehicles to take his crush out on a date to McDonaldsWhen Lee Robinson received a text from his nephew asking about odd jobs, he had an idea Image: Kennedy News and MediaByJulia BanimAudience WriterNia Price:,  Mar |comments When Lee Robinson received a text from his -year-old nephew Lloyd Catlow, asking whether there were any odd jobs he could do for him in exchange for pocket money, he decided to invite him over to his workplace.Lee, who works as operations director of a commercial cleaning service company, says young Lloyd spent a good two hours washing six of his vehicles and was left over the moon with his £ earnings.The teenager had apparently never thought of asking for money for free, and would have rather earned a few quid through hard work so that he could take a girl he liked out on a date to McDonaldaposs. Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here. Lee, of Colne, Lancashire, was so left impressed with Lloydaposs positive attitude and fantastic overall work that he offered him a regular job at his company.Going forward, Lloyd will be cleaning his uncleaposs vehicles every month in exchange for some hard-earned cash. His work ethic has clearly already paid off, as he was able to treat his crush to an upgraded date at a local milkshake parlour.Lee, , has since praised his nephewaposs work ethic online, in a post that has clocked up more than , likes and comments. The proud uncle explained: Lloyd just messaged me out of the blue and said that he wanted to take this young lady to McDonaldaposs and askedI had any work for him. I was really buzzing because Iaposve always had a job since I was , paper rounds and whatnot. Heaposs always expressed an interest in being a Saturday boy, earning a bit of money, and having a job to pay for his boxing classes and stuff like that. He never even had an inkling towards receiving any money for free. I said aposno problem, Iaposll find you something. Iaposm sure you can wash the vans and get them ready to goapos.Weaposre going to invite him back every month to do the vans inside and out, so heaposs gained himself a job from it, by just having that little bit of initiative and asking. Itaposs sort of the message that you want to send across really, it was just a chance message and I work in sales and operations so I see that day-to-day - Iaposll e-mail a client aposhow are you doing  We havenapost seen each other for a whileapos and sometimes it can turn into a job. I just wanted to show that to him, itaposs about getting off of your backside and he seems to be wanting to work and he showed that, I was really over the moon for him. Iaposve got two boys and a girl and I hope that they have that same ethic and drive that heaposs got, which is really good for a young lad. Speaking about his work, Lloyd said: It felt really good to finally be able to take the young lady out and it was just so much better with it being money that I earned myself through hard work. Meanwhile, a LinkedIn post written by Lee about his hardworking nephew has seen the youngster heaped with praise and hailed as an aposold-fashioned gentapos. Kim Billy Leipold commented: This is indeed inspirational. I used to do this when I was a kid, but not with car washing instead in our shoe factory. I help every weekend and summer vacations to earn money, helping to put on shoelaces, polish shoes and box them. As my parents taught meI was something I have to earn it either with good grades or by working! This kid will be in the future very successful! Kudos Kid! Christopher Brazell wrote: This is phenomenal! If he continues in this way, heaposs not going to need to be calling around asking for work, people will be calling him. Great job goes to the young man, and also the family who influences an incredible attitude towards work and reward. Hats off to you! And great job picking the milkshake place over McDonaldaposs! Another win for the young man, his parents, and the young lady! Good stuff!Do you have a heartwarming story to share  We pay for stories. title: woman hysterics shaving blunder leaves
story: Woman in hysterics as shaving blunder leaves dog looking like a money boxAn accidental shaving gaffe led to a golden retriever resembling a dog charity money box and looking pretty sad about it after she moved her head into the shaverRach accidentally saved a patch on her dogs headByJohn BettAudience WriterCharles Wade-PalmerReporter:,  Mar |comments A dog owner left their golden retriever looking like a charity money box after a shaving accident left the pooch with a notch on her head. Rach Sharpe shared the hilarious mistake on Facebook to the group Golden Retrievers UK where dog lovers responded in fits of laughter, as the Daily Star reports.She said she was trying to give her partner a trim and the dog approached and she slipped with the shaver, leaving the pet with a distinct notch in her head. With the slot, the dog looked exactly like the iconic Guide Dogs for the Blind charity box, and Rach, from Gloucester, was left in stitches. What do you think about Rachaposs shaving mishap  Let us know in the comments...Taking to Facebook, Rach said: Was trimming my husbandaposs beard and she came up behind me I was like oh yeah I’ll shave the dogand she moved her head and now has this line in her head. She looks like a money box and I can’t even look at her without crying. One person commented: Insert coin, dispense wags. A second wrote: There should be treats in the shape of coins. For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newslettershere. And a third joked: A penny for her thoughts  Other puns thrown in on the thread included: Doge coin and I need her  cents for ious reasons.Meanwhile, a dog nicknamed Mr Ugly, is searching for a new home after being found alone on a mountain. The five-year-old dog, who is completely blind, was taken in by Blind Dog Rescue UK after spending a year wandering alone on a mountainside.He was in a really bad way with hardly any fur on his body when he was picked up by the rescue. Actually called Vincent, the lonely dog is hoping somebody in the UK will come forward to offer in a place in their home. A spokesperson from Blind Dog Rescue UK said: Introducing the gorgeous Vincent who has the unfortunate nickname of Mr Ugly at the shelter. news weird-news woman-left-red-faced-after-"TikToker regrets botched eyeliner tattooByJohn BettAudience Writer:,  Mar |comments A woman decided to save some time and money by getting her eyeliner permanently tattooed onto her face - but she soon regretted it and wanted it removed.Permanent make-up is all the rage at the minute with people paying to get their favourite designs done by a tattooist, so they donapost need to redo it every single day. TikTok star Abby shared a video of her mishap online, saying that the tattoo artist botched her inking and left her with wobbly, uneven lines.In her social media video, Abby explained that she now wants to get her eyeliner tattoo removed, and wrote online OMG, help! What do you think about Abbyaposs tattoo  Let us know in the comments... Sharing her story on TikTok, where she uploads as @abby, Abby wrote: Thought it would be a good idea to get tattoo eyeliner and this is the outcome. OMG help.She captioned the video: Yes itaposs permanent. Currently in the process of having it removed #tattooeyeliner #botched. Abbyaposs video soon had thousands of views and people commented to say they had been through a similar experience. One wrote: Ha ha, I did the same... eight years later and it’s still on.  For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newslettershere.Meanwhile, a woman shocked her fans on social media after revealing she spent  minutes every day doing her eyelashes - as some thought they look like spiders.TikTok user Brenna said that of her face of make-up, her eyelashes were the most important bit to get right - and one mistake ruins her whole look.She would spend up to  minutes each day applying mascara and wanted to get it just right and had her own particular style that she loved. But not everyone enjoyed her look, as some said her eyelashes were too thick and spindly - and one social media user even said they looked like spider legs. title: group buy caribbean island turn
story: Group buy Caribbean island and turn it into their own country with secret policeCoffee Caye is a .-acre uninhabited tropical paradise off the coast of Belize and is now better known as the Principality of IslandiaIn  the Lets Buy an Island project was started with the aim of crowdfunding for an island Image: FacebookByEthan Blackshaw:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |commentsA group who bought a Caribbean island have now started their own country, complete with its own national flag, anthem, government and “secret police force”. Coffee Caye is a .-acre uninhabited tropical paradise off the coast of Belize and is now better known as the Principality of Islandia. The island, which is shaped a bit like a coffee bean, can be walked in just minutes. But its small size hasnapost stopped the micronation from claiming independence. In  the Letaposs Buy an Island project was started with the aim of crowdfunding for an island and by December  it had raised over £,. The group picked Coffee Caye, located just a -minute boat ride from Belize City, and forked out £, plus tax. Lets Buy an Island co-founder Marshall Mayer toldCNN: Who wouldnapost want to buy an island That feeling of stepping onto an island that youaposve invested in, and own, thataposs an amazing feeling. The idea for Islandia was actually born  years ago when co-founder and CEO Gareth Johnson bought the domain name letsbuyanisland, thinking that the idea sounded funny, The Daily Star reports.  After looking into it over a number of years the group realised that buying an island was much more realistic than they originally imagined. Investors can now buy shares in Islandia for £,, with each of the shareholders entitled to one vote in the micronationaposs democracy.  people have also bought citizenship for just £ without actually becoming an investor.Johnson toldCNN: Who hasnapost dreamed of making their own country  Particularly in a post-Trump, post-Brexit, Covid world. If a bunch of regular people can make this work, perhaps it can be a force for good.  Islandia now has its own flag, novelty passports, a national anthem and government elected by the investors. Johnson even joked that he has a special role as Head of the Secret Police. This year marked the first tour of the island, with Mayer taking a group of investors and tourists for a camping trip. Those going in the future will have to abide by a number of special rules such as aposno single-use plasticapos, although in reality it still falls under the jurisdiction of Belize. Put simply, a micronation is an entity whose members claim to be a sovereign state but arenapost recognised by world governments or major international organisations. The claims are so trivial that they are largely ignored by the countries around them.  One of the most notable examples is the Principality of Sealand, an anti-aircraft  in the North Sea built during World War Two and seized by a pirate radio group in . Sealand continues to assert its status as a nation by issuing its own money and stamps. The Free Republic of Liberland was founded in , sitting between Croatia and Serbia. Border disputes between the countries mean some land there is claimed by both or neither. Liberland has even established formal ties with Somaliland, a de facto state in the Horn of Africa.
